foundations/windows/gates/borders. These elements of the city's architecture symbolize the whole city. Windows is more correctly translated as battlements or towers, which are set atop walls and used for defense. Borders are the outer walls of the city. The precious stones that form the city's architecture symbolize the love and care the Lord will lavish on his people.

sapphires/agates/carbuncles/pleasant stones. These precious stones seem to symbolize the spiritual and temporal blessings the Lord will pour out on his people (60:17; Rev. 21:18-21). Sapphires were sparkling blue stones, but probably not the sapphires of today—they may have been lapis lazuli (NEB, NIV, NRSV); agates likely were what we know as rubies; carbuncles may have been clear crystals; pleasant stones can better be translated as "precious stones" (NKJV, NIV, JB).
